Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Schnitzer Steel agreed to pay $1.55 million in civil penalties, $2.1 million towards Supplemental Environmental Projects, and $450,000 in costs in settlement of allegations its metal shredding and recycling facility released particulates contaminated with hazardous metals into the neighboring environment.

Company: Metals Recycling, LLC, Izzo Group, Inc., and Metals Recycling, Inc.
Description: Izzo Group and Metals Recycling agreed to pay $700,872 in settlement of allegations they ran diesel engines at their facility from 1987 without obtaining permits and paying fees for emissions. $450,872 of the penalty could be offset by a Supplemental Environmental Project involving replacing the generators with electric motors.
